article.title: Angular momentum evolution of galaxies over the past 10-Gyr: A MUSE and KMOS dynamical survey of 400 star-forming galaxies from z=0.3-1.7

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the left panel of Figure 2 show?
choices: The redshift distribution of [OII] and Hα emitters for MUSE and KMOS samples
The relationship between stellar mass and specific angular momentum of galaxies at z=0
The evolution of the physical half-light radii of galaxies with redshift
The [OII] luminosity function for star-forming galaxies split into two redshift bins

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the small blue points in Figure 3 represent?
choices: Galaxies with high specific star formation rates (sSFR > 10 Gyr^-1)
Galaxies classified as unresolved or compact in the MUSE or KMOS data
Galaxies with specific star formation rates typical of the “main-sequence” population
Galaxies with low specific star formation rates (sSFR < 0.1 Gyr^-1)

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dashed line in Figure 6 represent?
choices: The average half-light radius of late-type galaxies at z=0
The half-light radius as a function of redshift for the median seeing of the observations (0.7")
The evolution of the continuum sizes of galaxies in the CANDLES fields
The redshift evolution of the specific angular momentum of galaxies in the EAGLE simulation

multiple_choice_question.text: Which group of galaxies is represented by the red solid line in Figure 7?
choices: Galaxies with spatially resolved nebular emission
Galaxies with irregular or face-on morphologies
